sentences.en: an inextricable connection between the past and the present
sentences.cn: 过去和现在之间密不可分的关系

sentences.en: Art and history fuse in inextricable magic.
sentences.cn: 艺术和历史魔术般地溶和在一起,难解难分.
艺术和生活是分不开的。

sentences.en: In the Middle Ages, philosophy and theology were inextricable.
sentences.cn: 在中世纪, 哲学与神学是不分的.

sentences.en: Meetings are an inextricable part of business.
sentences.cn: 会议是商业密不可分的一部分。

sentences.en: My heart sink again on viewing the inextricable complexity of this deception.
sentences.cn: 看到这个骗局的错综复杂,我的心又沉了下来.

sentences.en: Shall I go even further, and say in inextricable peril?
sentences.cn: 我能不能说得更严重一点儿, 是处于难以脱身的险境之中 呢 ?

sentences.en: the inextricable connection between language and culture
sentences.cn: 语言和文化之间密不可分的联系

sentences.en: There are many trees in the mountain, as if an inextricable maze.
sentences.cn: 这座山上有好多好多的林子, 走也走不完.

sentences.en: This dissected the special feature of liberalism ideology and its inextricable inner contradiction and complexity respectively.
sentences.cn: 这些赋予梁实秋自由主义思想以特有的风采,同时也带来无法解脱的内在矛盾和复杂性.

sentences.en: Thoreau viewed man as an inextricable part of nature.
sentences.cn: 梭罗认为人是自然不可分割的一部分。

sentences.en: Why are not all organic being blend together in an inextricable chaos?
sentences.cn: 为什么一切生物不是混合成为不可分解的紊乱状态 呢 ?

words.tran_cn: 逃不掉地；解不开地；解决不了地

trans.tran_en: two or more things that are inextricable are closely related and affect each other
